result.execSummary:
The defendant James R Koebler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 10 days jail in lieu of payment of costs.  Time served.
Sentence credit of 140 days jail was granted.  Time served.

Defendant James R Koebler in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended Count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Sentence of:
130 Days Jail.  (Credit - 140 days).  TIME SERVED. 
COSTS:  $243.00 In lieu of paying the costs, defendant to serve 10 days in jail.  (Credit - 10 days).  TIME SERVED.
Received June 3, 2016, from Atty Fragoso, requesting change in sentencing date
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
